result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Douglas Connors Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Review Hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
No contact with DRUG HOUSES, DRUG DEALERS, DRUG PARAPHERNALIA.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
01-26-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 9 months, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.
**  **  **  **  **  
Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction at the DAY REPORTING CENTER.  The court will stay that pending a review on 12-17-2015 to determine if the defendant has gone into treatment, AND IF SO THE 9 months is to be stayed.  Appearance is waived if in-patient.  If treatment has not begun the defendant is to report on 12-18-2015 to DRC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Douglas Connors Jr

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-26-16 Court order imposing 9 months of condition time
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions-Domestic Violence Court, signed and filed.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Scott Douglas Connors not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman for Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Vicki Bewick appeared for the Department of Corrections. Case in court for review hearing. State is requesting that the 9 months condition time be imposed due to non-compliance. Defense does not object. Court orders that the 9 months condition time be imposed due to non-compliance.

Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Vicki Bewick and Sarah Watson present in court.  The DOC had issued a warrant for the defendant for his failure to comply with probation which was cancelled yesterday.  Defendant has not obtained placed for in-patient treatment at the UCC.  Defense and DOC are requesting an additional 30 days to set a plan for treatment for defendant.  The court will continue the STAY of the 9 months until the next review date of 1-26-2016  Review hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court from all parties; additional statement by Scott C., Sr.
Court has been advised that the defendant is on the wait list for residential treatment at UCC.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 6 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.  Conditions of probation/EXTENDED SUPERVISION include:
-Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction at the DAY REPORTING CENTER.  The court will stay that pending a review on 12-17-2015 to determine if the defendant has gone into treatment, AND IF SO THE 9 months is to be stayed.  Appearance is waived if in-patient.  If treatment has not begun the defendant is to report on 12-18-2015 to DRC.
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-No contact with DRUG HOUSES, DRUG DEALERS, DRUG PARAPHERNALIA
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

Court ordered the defendant to stay at his father's residence and that he not commit any new crimes that rise to the level of probable cause. Court will allow entry to UCC for treatment. Case adjourned in branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 38.

Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 11/25/15 at 8:30 am in Branch 17.  Court also ordered no additional adjournments in this case.  Court addresses the JusticePoint pretrial report received and notes defendant is to continue to comply.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated October 20, 2015 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing. 
 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-21-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated September 11, 2015 received and filed. tk

15RM007315  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-11-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Scott Douglas Connors in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
